Cathedral and Metropolitical Church of Christ at Canterbury
Christ Church (Canterbury, England)
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The cathedral of the Archbishop of Canterbury, leader of the Church of England and symbolic leader of the worldwide Anglican Communion. [work]

Founded in 597, the cathedral completely rebuilt between 1070 and 1077. Additions from the 12th to the 19th centuries. Before the English Reformation the cathedral was part of a Benedictine monastic community known as Christ Church, Canterbury, as well as being the seat of the archbishop. Burial place of Saint Thomas Becket; shrine to Becket erected 1180-1184, removed in 1538. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canterbury_Cathedral [work]
